data.title: Nice Coney Island & More
data.text: This Leo's has good service and good food at a decent price.  The daily special are a good value.  While there are several Leo's in the area this is my favorite one.  The staff is friendly and service is good.  The food is very tasty at a fair price.

data.title: good food
data.text: Workers very friendly. Lots of food on menu.  Clean, Food was very good. There was a good selection of deserts .

data.title: Good food and plenty of it!
data.text: We were surprised that at lunch time there were very few cars in the lot.  That's sometimes not a good sign.  We weren't sure what a "Coney Island" was but saw this restaurant advertised on TV and wanted to give it a try.  They have LOTS to choose from on the menu.  They have booth style seating.  Our waitress was very good.  I ordered the chicken shish ka bob.dinner.  It came with a nice warm pita, rice, tacziki sauce chopped onion and tomato so you could build it yourself.   I ended up taking half of it home.  The salad was huge!  My husband had th elemon  rice soup and a greek salad.  He couldn't finish all his either!  Nice relaxed atmosphere, good service and great food.  We will return!

data.title: Better to Have Stayed in Coney Island
data.text: I stopped by here for a late dinner and was disappointed. The server was young and friendly but inexperienced. The omelette was dry and almost tasteless. The whole wheat toast had an "off" taste. Certainly not a place that I want to return to for a meal.

data.title: A little disappointed.
data.text: My wife and I arrived about 9:15 am, as we  were thinking of having breakfast.    But upon looking at the large selections available, we ordered something else.    I ordered a small Greek salad.  My wife decided on the fish and chips.    My salad was about average when comparing with others I have eaten.   I had a bit of a problem with the Greek dressing.   It was the type where the seasonings separate form the oil.   It came in a small tub.   Mine was so full, that when I opened it, some of the oil spilled onto my hand.   I had to excuse my self and head for the wash room.   I prefer the thicker, blended style of dressing.     The dinner fish and chips came with a side salad with the requested Caesar dressing (the thick style) and her's looked better than mine.    The three pieces of  (I think it was cod)  were hand dipped in batter and deep fried.   The French fries were the standard frozen variety.     Although the restaurant was not very busy,  the fish and chips came only moderately hot.    It appeared to have been left under the heat lamp a few minutes too long.    I don't think we'll return for a second try.

data.title: On a budget, no problem!
data.text:
With soooooo many options, it's hard to decide what to get. The location at Southland Mall is a favorite of ours. A couple can eat on a budget for under $25 with a tip. Try and get a table near the kitchen, that way you never have to wonder where your server is. Do not think that the service is bad for a minute. Sitting near the kitchen alway gets quicker service from the staff. There's your dining tip. 

Great food and service keeps me and my fiancé coming back time and time again.

data.title: Great spinach pie
data.text: They have many items to choose from,  soup, salads, and the spinach pie are great.  Breakfast for supper is one of my favorites.

data.title: Family eatery
data.text: Great place for family to eat.  Many choices and friendly service.  Love their coney dogs and specials.

data.title: Food
data.text: The Michigan salad with grilled chicken and the fish and chips are very good.  The service is fast and friendly.

data.title: Leo's food is good.
data.text: Leo's has great food but the background is very noisy in the mail section.  The cooks amd their dishes are noisy.  This is a great place for small parties if your in the back sectio it is more quiet.

data.title: Nice Coney Island.
data.text: Waitress was great and very attentive to our needs. Greek salad could be better, salad was bland. Patty melt was good. Prices were not too expensive. Would go again

data.title: Decent food at A decent price
data.text: good menu items, decent food. a fairly good value. It is a great place to visit when you are just hungry and want something good to eat.

data.title: Morning Service with a Smile
data.text: My second visit here and I must say it was a vast improvement.  The first visit was for lunch which didn't impress me at all as I indicated in another review.  This visit was breakfast.  All staff was very pleasant and accommodating to our needs.  Eggs were cooked exactly as I requested, everything was hot, and they were quick with coffee refills.  Couldn't ask for anything better.  I'll definitely return.

data.title: Leo's is always great
data.text:
My wife and I frequent Leo's often - The have GREAT Captain Crunch French Toast - you must try.  The coney's are great as is the wait staff. This location above all is more open not closed in like most coney island's. 
Yes it is traditional Coney Island - Fries - Onion Rings but they have a great breakfast menu as well - If your in the area stop in - It wont be disappointing.

4 out of 5 Stars

data.title: Thumbs Down Lunch
data.text: I ordered a gyro with fries.  Not sure how that can be screwed up but it was a little.  Part of the gyro was actually hard, so it was either dried out or it was fried/grilled or whatever too long.  The fries were cold which made them chewy.  I really should have sent them back but I was with a friend, didn't want to make a fuss in front of her, so I just loaded them up with ketchup.  This lunch was disappointing.  The cook needs a refresher course.  On the up side, our server was friendly and quick as was the cashier.
